title: cell_type_annotation
description: Annotate gene expression data with cell type classes through the scGPT model.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The output mudata file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The output mudata file.

output_obs_predictions.description: Type: `string`, default: `scgpt_pred`. The name of the adata
output_obs_predictions.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scgpt_pred`. The name of the adata.obs column to write predicted cell type labels to.

output_obs_probability.description: Type: `string`, default: `scgpt_probability`. The name of the adata
output_obs_probability.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scgpt_probability`. The name of the adata.obs column to write the probabilities of the predicted cell type labels to.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects
output_compression.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects.
By default no compression is applied.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The padding token used in the model
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The padding token used in the model.

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding.

n_input_bins.description: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of input bins
n_input_bins.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of input bins.

dsbn.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to use domain-specific batch normalization
dsbn.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to use domain-specific batch normalization.

seed.description: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation
seed.help_text: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation. If not specified, no seed is used.

model.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. The model file containing checkpoints and cell type label mapper
model.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. The model file containing checkpoints and cell type label mapper.

model_config.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The model configuration file
model_config.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The model configuration file.

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory.

finetuned_checkpoints_key.description: Type: `string`, default: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model file containing the pretrained checkpoints
finetuned_checkpoints_key.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model file containing the pretrained checkpoints.

label_mapper_key.description: Type: `string`, default: `id_to_class`. Key in the model file containing the cell type class to label mapper dictionary
label_mapper_key.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `id_to_class`. Key in the model file containing the cell type class to label mapper dictionary.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `scgpt_preprocess_ouput.h5mu`. The input h5mu file containing of data that have been pre-processed (normalized, binned, genes cross-checked and tokenized)
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `scgpt_preprocess_ouput.h5mu`. The input h5mu file containing of data that have been pre-processed (normalized, binned, genes cross-checked and tokenized).

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality from the input MuData file to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality from the input MuData file to process.

obs_batch_label.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata
obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata.obs column containing the batch labels. Required if dsbn is set to true.

obsm_gene_tokens.description: Type: `string`, default: `gene_id_tokens`. The key of the
obsm_gene_tokens.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `gene_id_tokens`. The key of the .obsm array containing the gene token ids

obsm_tokenized_values.description: Type: `string`, default: `values_tokenized`. The key of the
obsm_tokenized_values.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `values_tokenized`. The key of the .obsm array containing the count values of the tokenized genes

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
